name: Brazil Nuts
description: Brazil nuts are large, creamy nuts with a rich, earthy flavor. They're renowned for being the world's richest source of selenium, a powerful antioxidant mineral.
characteristics: Large size, creamy texture, rich earthy flavor

terroir.geography: Amazon rainforest - wild trees growing 50+ meters tall, NOT cultivated plantations
terroir.climate: Hot, humid tropical rainforest with year-round moisture
terroir.soil: Rich rainforest soil nourished by biodiverse ecosystem
terroir.whySpecial: Brazil nuts CANNOT be cultivated - they ONLY grow wild in the Amazon rainforest. Hand-harvested from towering trees, each nut is a connection to the untamed Amazon. This is pure wild terroir, not plantation farming.

originStory: Brazil nuts are one of nature's true wild-crafted treasures. They cannot be cultivated on plantations - they only grow wild in the Amazon rainforest, harvested by hand from towering 50-meter trees. The rich, biodiverse rainforest soil and complex ecosystem create nuts with an intense, earthy flavor and incredible nutritional density. Each Brazil nut is a connection to the untamed Amazon.
tastingNotes: Earthy, intense flavor, creamy texture, subtle sweetness, rich and satisfying with unique wild character
whyWeCare: Wild-harvested, not cultivated. Brazil nuts are rainforest conservation in action - buying them supports indigenous communities and protects wild forests. The only nut that cannot be commercially cultivated - pure wild terroir.
uniqueFact: Just 2 Brazil nuts provide 247% RDA selenium - nature's most concentrated source of this essential mineral for thyroid health

benefits.detail: World's richest natural source - supports thyroid function
Selenium essential for thyroid hormone production

nutritionalHighlights.tagline: Brazil Nuts: Two a day keeps the doctor away
nutritionalHighlights.reason: Just 2 nuts provide your entire daily selenium requirement - the most selenium-rich food on Earth.
nutritionalHighlights.servingRecommendation: Limit to 2-4 nuts per day due to extremely high selenium content
